# openxlsx2Extras

The goal of openxlsx2Extras is to extend the functionality of the
[{openxlsx2} R package](https://github.com/JanMarvin/openxlsx2).

This package is *very* early stages so expect things to change and break
as I learn more about {openxlsx2} and figure out the appropriate design
for this package.

## Installation

You can install the development version of openxlsx2Extras like so:

``` r
pak::pkg_install("elipousson/openxlsx2Extras")
```

## Example

``` r
library(openxlsx2)
library(openxlsx2Extras)
```

As of December 2024, the main types of functions in
[openxlsx2Extras](https://github.com/elipousson/openxlsx2Extras)
include:

- Wrapper functions for existing
  [openxlsx2](https://janmarvin.github.io/openxlsx2/) functions that add
  some extra features,
  e.g. [`wb_save_ext()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_save_ext.md)
  wraps
  [`openxlsx2::wb_save()`](https://janmarvin.github.io/openxlsx2/reference/wb_save.html)
- Convenience functions for multiple
  [openxlsx2](https://janmarvin.github.io/openxlsx2/) for convenience
  and more concise code,
  e.g. [`openxlsx2Extras::wb_new_workbook()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_new_workbook.md)
  combines
  [`openxlsx2::wb_workbook()`](https://janmarvin.github.io/openxlsx2/reference/wb_workbook.html)
  and
  [`openxlsx2::wb_add_worksheet()`](https://janmarvin.github.io/openxlsx2/reference/wb_add_worksheet.html)
- Other functions that support Markdown formatted text
  ([`wb_add_marquee_text()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_add_marquee_text.md)),
  lists of workbooks
  ([`map_wb()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/map_wb.md)),
  lists of data frames (`wb_as_df_list()`), and coercion of more kinds
  of objects into spreadsheet-friendly formats
  ([`prep_wb_data()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/prep_wb_data.md))

For example,
[`wb_save_ext()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_save_ext.md)
allows users to set a filename based on the workbook title:

``` r
wb <- wb_workbook(
  title = "Title used for output file"
)

wb <- wb$add_worksheet()

withr::with_tempdir({
  wb_save_ext(wb)
  fs::dir_ls()
})
#> Title used for output file.xlsx
```

[`wb_new_workbook()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_new_workbook.md)
supports creating multiple worksheets in a single function call
(recycling additional arguments like `tab_color` to match the length of
`sheet_names`):

``` r
wb_new_workbook(
  title = "Workbook created with wb_new_workbook",
  sheet_names = c("First sheet", "Second sheet"),
  tab_color = c(wb_color("orange"), wb_color("yellow"))
)
#> A Workbook object.
#>  
#> Worksheets:
#>  Sheets: First sheet, Second sheet 
#>  Write order: 1, 2
```

## Related Projects

Packages extending [openxlsx](https://github.com/ycphs/openxlsx)

- [tablexlsx](https://ddotta.github.io/tablexlsx/)
  [ddotta/tablexlsx](https://github.com/ddotta/tablexlsx)
- `{a11ytables}`
  [co-analysis/a11ytables](https://github.com/co-analysis/a11ytables):
  generate best-practice stats spreadsheets for publication
- `{gtopenxlsx}`
  [yannsay/gtopenxlsx](https://github.com/yannsay/gtopenxlsx): tables to
  xlsx format through openxlsx

Packages extending [openxlsx2](https://github.com/JanMarvin/openxlsx2)

- [flexlsx](https://github.com/pteridin/flexlsx):
  [pteridin/flexlsx](https://github.com/pteridin/flexlsx) add flextables
  to Excel files
- `{a11ytables2}`:
  [matt-dray/a11ytables2](https://github.com/matt-dray/a11ytables2):
  generate best-practice stats spreadsheets for publication

Packages extending [readxl](https://readxl.tidyverse.org)

- [forgts](https://github.com/luisDVA/forgts)
  [luisDVA/forgts](https://github.com/luisDVA/forgts)}: reads a
  spreadsheet and its formatting information to produce gt tables with
  the same cell and text formatting as the input file.

Packages for working with Microsoft Office files

- [officer](https://ardata-fr.github.io/officeverse/)
  [davidgohel/officer](https://github.com/davidgohel/officer/): office
  documents from R
- `{officerExtras}`
  [elipousson/officerExtras](https://github.com/elipousson/officerExtras):
  A R package with {officer} helper functions.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`as_data_validation_value()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/as_data_validation_value.md)
  : Prepare a character vector as a data validation string

- [`as_wb()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/as_wb.md)
  : Coerce a data frame or list of data frames to a workbook

- [`common_dxfs_styles`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/common_dxfs_styles.md)
  : Common dxfs styles

- [`csv_to_wb()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/convert_to.md)
  [`csv_to_xlsx()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/convert_to.md)
  [`xlsx_to_csv()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/convert_to.md)
  : Convert CSV to XLSX files or XLSX to CSV

- [`fmt_lgl_cols()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/fmt_lgl_cols.md)
  : Format logical vector columns to use replacement values

- [`fmt_marquee_txt()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/fmt_marquee_txt.md)
  **\[experimental\]** :

  Use
  [`marquee::marquee_parse()`](https://marquee.r-lib.org/reference/marquee_parse.html)
  to format Markdown text

- [`prep_wb_data()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/prep_wb_data.md)
  : Prepare data for adding to a workbook

- [`read_xlsx_ext()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/read_xlsx_ext.md)
  **\[experimental\]** : Create a data frame from a Workbook (with extra
  features)

- [`set_excel_fmt_class()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/set_excel_fmt_class.md)
  **\[experimental\]** : Prepare a data frame with Excel style class
  values for formatting by openxlsx2

- [`vec_fmt_lgl()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/vec_fmt_lgl.md)
  : Format a logical vector to specified values

- [`wb_add_data_ext()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_add_data_ext.md)
  **\[experimental\]** :

  Add data using
  [`openxlsx2::wb_add_data()`](https://janmarvin.github.io/openxlsx2/reference/wb_add_data.html)
  with extra features

- [`wb_add_marquee_text()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_add_marquee_text.md)
  **\[experimental\]** : Add Markdown formatted text to a Workbook

- [`wb_add_styles()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_add_styles.md)
  : Add a named list of styles to a workbook

- [`wb_new_workbook()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_new_workbook.md)
  : Create a new workbook and add named work sheets

- [`wb_protect_worksheets()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_protect_worksheets.md)
  : Protect one or more sheets in a workbook

- [`wb_rename_data()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_rename_data.md)
  : Rename column names in workbook data

- [`wb_rename_sheets()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_rename_sheets.md)
  [`wb_rename_sheets_with()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_rename_sheets.md)
  : Rename workbook sheets using a tidyselect syntax

- [`wb_save_ext()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_save_ext.md)
  **\[experimental\]** : Save a workboook object to file while filling
  file name from assigned workbook title

- [`wb_set_properties_ext()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_set_properties_ext.md)
  : Set workbook properties

- [`wb_split()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_split.md)
  :

  Use
  [`dplyr::group_split`](https://dplyr.tidyverse.org/reference/group_split.html)
  to split a workbook into a list of workbooks

- [`wb_to_df_list()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/wb_to_df_list.md)
  : Convert a workbook to a list of data frames

- [`write_xlsx_ext()`](https://elipousson.github.io/openxlsx2Extras/reference/write_xlsx_ext.md)
  **\[experimental\]** : Write data to an xlsx file with additional
  features
